tool.name: MzTabExporter
tool.description: Exports various XML formats to an mzTab file.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing #if $in: mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && #end if mkdir out &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd #if $in: -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' #end if -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("mztab")}'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("mztab")}' '$out'

param.name: in
param.label: Input files used to generate the mzTab file

param.name: opt_columns
param.label: Add optional columns which are not part of the mzTab standard

param.name: first_run_inference_only
param.label: Does the first IdentificationRun in the file only represent (protein) inference results
param.help: If so, read peptide information only from second to last runs

tool.help:
Exports various XML formats to an mzTab file.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/documentation/TOPP_MzTabExporter.html
